channel.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
channel.description:
Curious to know how users prefer to export their Auxy tracks.
Do you typically export as Uncompressed WAV or as 128 kbps M4A (using the Export Audio option)?
[poll type=regular] * _Always_ WAV * _Usually_ WAV * About the same * _Usually_ M4A * _Always_ M4A [/poll]

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: SWIM
item.description:
M4A when u wanna toss ideas or a song with minimal size, like via tec or email. Maybe post somewhere or whatever.
WAV when working with audio professionally under any circumstance. Mixing, collab, etc

Read full topic

item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

It’s probably still a good idea to have a presence on SC as well, even if it’s not your main channel.
Otherwise, you’re needlessly missing out on one potential source of new audience.

It’s very much a necessary evil for creators.

That said, when consuming music, I’d much rather purchase and download a lossless version from Bandcamp (which also benefits the artist as opposed to lining the pockets of Souncloud, Spotify et al).

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
blakkaz:

the reason I avoid Soundcloud

It’s probably still a good idea to have a presence on SC as well, even if it’s not your main channel.
Otherwise, you’re needlessly missing out on one potential source of new audience.

Assuming you’re uploading a good master, the resultant audio quality of your SC tracks will sound no worse than others on there. So, it’s kind of a level playing field as far as the impact of audio quality on audience appeal goes.

Read full topic

item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
They’re gonna be doing compression undoubtedly also, so if you’re exporting to M4A and then uploading there (and it’s getting compressed again) then you could experience more loss of the audio quality - but, just to re-iterate, if your ears are satisfied with what you hear (quality, volume, presence etc) then it doesn’t really matter.

It’s like someone can look at a Picasso or Rembrandt, and think it’s awesome, and then another person can look at the same painting and think it’s a total pile of garbage. It’s not like this compression is going to affect the track in such a way that suddenly it’s downsampled to 4 bits and 11khz like a bit crusher effect…

But, this is just my 2¢

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
I wouldn’t worry too much, it really depends on what you’re doing with what you export. If I wasn’t exporting and then running the mix through Grand Finale, truth told, I’d probably just export directly to SoundCloud. If you’re happy with the mix and how it sounds, don’t worry about it. Our ears are the final arbiter.

For people who want to bring stems into another app, or a desktop DAW, the obvious choice is to export them uncompressed with no other “Auxy sauce mastering effects.” You’d want the cleanest, most un-adultered version of the audio you could get so that when you bring it into your app of choice it’s the best quality possible.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: Maland2016
item.description:
Ohhhhh, crap…
I’ve been using m4a this whole time! I think I screwed up…

Okay, y’know what? Screw it. I don’t care if it’s lesser quality, I’m still gonna use m4a. I am NOT going back to undo the damage, I’d have to reupload everything, my songs, my albums, my remixes…

Sorry, not doing that.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I would agree, but the poll results seem to show that the WAV is the more popular option – whether that’s direct upload to SC or exporting the Uncompressed WAV.
Fewer users seem to make use of the lower quality M4A versions, so it doesn’t quite match up to the JPG vs. RAW comparison.

 

I have slow internet and it uploads waaaay to fast to be wav files. I’m pretty sure their smaller files.

Renders are required for the SC upload option to be available and renders are uncompressed WAV.

 

you’re going to scare users who are new to this information

It’s definitely worth every Auxy user knowing the difference between lossy and lossless formats.
(The app doesn’t disclose that info, so it’s good if the community educates its members.)

Besides, according to Lenberg, “It’s not a beginner app.”

If it’s not a beginner app, then popular, pro-quality options shouldn’t be bumped to a secondary menu.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: brandnaqua
item.description:
omg you’re going to scare users who are new to this information

guys (newer to file management) as long as you’ve hopefully saved your project files you’re good because then you could export them as wavs later on for purposes resulting in higher quality… If not don’t worry. I have 5 megapixel JPEG images I have taken long ago on my iPhone 4 that have great value even now when we have much greater quality images surrounding us. As long as you have your music, in whatever quality you’re good, but of course for future reference do your best to maintain the projects for higher quality file exports ️

item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: brandnaqua
item.description:
I think the uncompressed wav option is fine where it’s at, people who have a use for the higher quality will typically know what it’s for and those who don’t may not even have the need for such a large file because they wouldn’t even care for the benefit provided by such a file. It’s good to educate people on what it is though so i’m glad this was brought up. It’s like in the photography world where you only use JPEG (kinda like music’s MP3/M4A) then you learn what RAW is (like music’s uncompressed wav) and you then switch to RAW for master images and JPEG for public files. Where photos and photo files originate- in retouching or even the camera settings (kinda equivalent to production apps) TIFF/DNGs, which are closest to original RAW files, are saved within the same option lists that you could save JPEGs in so I think it’s fine.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I think you’re right. I probably should have included SoundCloud as an option in the poll as many will be using it without knowing (and maybe not caring) which format it exports as or ends up as. So, in that sense, it does stand alone and doesn’t cleanly correlate to choosing ‘Uncompressed WAV’, as you say.

Ultimately, my original post is an attempt to do a few things…

  • Better understand who’s exporting as ‘Audio’ (M4A) and why?
  • To check my assumption that fewer users choose ‘Audio’/M4A compared to other options for exporting the entire track
  • Make a case for moving ‘Uncompressed WAV’ to the first set of menu options.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
You can’t export a file simply by tapping a button labelled ‘Export’.

You’ve been making a second, specific menu selection: ‘Audio’, ‘SoundCloud’, Export Individual Instruments’ or ‘Uncompressed WAV’.

Read full topic

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: aUstin_Haga
item.description:
This is a great point, but my point would be that most would use the “upload to SoundCloud” option, where the end result is opus, rather than using the export wav option, and therefore would be counted as an option different from WAV.

The “Upload to SoundCloud” option is different than the “Uncompressed WAV” option.

Read full topic

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

SoundClouds rips every upload to 128 kbps MP3, regardless of the upload format/quality.

I’m pretty sure they changed to 64 kbps Opus a few months ago.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.title: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
As @blakkaz says, an uncompressed upload format means the cleanest end results.
Uploading a lossy, compressed format, (e.g. MP3, M4A/AAC,…), means it’s effectively being run through two, independent lossy compression processes, which does two rounds of damage.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Do you export to WAV or M4A?

item.description:

I don’t think that it should really count as wav, because it likely ends up as a different, smaller format in the end.

The source material will make a difference though.
